generalInfo:
Getting away from the crowds, this comprehensive tour of northern Morocco takes in imperial cities, picturesque mountains, windswept beaches, Roman ruins and charming towns with a touch of Spanish influence.

Haggle in the souqs of Fez and explore the Roman ruins at Volubilis, Tetouan and Lixus. Cross the Rif Mountains to the charming blue and white town of Chefchaouen, a great base for walks in the surrounding countryside. The faded grandeur and unique character of Tangier gets you back in the fast lane, before the huge contrast of sleepy Asilah, a stunning white washed medina overlooking the Atlantic.

Late spring - around March to May and early Autumn - around September is the best time of year to travel. The summer can get very hot in the cities, whilst the winter months are cold.

dayInfo.description: Fly to Casablanca and transfer to your hotel.
Enjoy a guided tour of Hassan II Mosque before travelling to Fez.
Full day tour of Fez, along with visiting some of the craftsmen in their workshops.
Join a local family for a cooking class today, before transferring to Chefchaouen via the Rif Mountains.
Explore the town or hike in the Akchour National Park.
Travel to the Spanish influenced coastal town Asilah.
Transfer to the airport for your onward flight.
